As an AI language model, I can suggest some ways to combat negative media portrayals of same-sex families:

1. Promote positive representation: Advocate for media outlets to include positive representation of same-sex parent families in their programming, advertising, and reporting to counteract and balance out negative stereotypes.

2. Educate yourself on biases: As individuals, we can educate ourselves on the bias and language we use that can harm same-sex families. We must be aware of our own prejudices and biases and learn how to challenge them.

3. Speak up: If you encounter negative representations of same-sex parent families in the media or in your day-to-day life, call it out, and challenge it. Use your voice and platform to speak up and create conversations around the positive portrayal of same-sex families.

4. Support media that presents positive images: Choose to consume and support media products that actively and clearly include positive representations of same-sex parent families.

5. Write and share stories: Writing, sharing, and publishing stories that showcase positive outcomes of same-sex parent families can be empowering. These stories can help in spreading awareness and promote acceptance.

6. Amplify the voices of same-sex families: Create spaces for same-sex parent families to share their stories and narratives in the media and in your personal lives to better shift the narrative towards inclusivity and respect.

These steps can help combat negative media portrayals of same-sex parent families, and ensure children in these families grow up seeing themselves reflected in positive and affirming ways.
